_label: Civil rights marchers morning campfire sends smoke spiraling skyward near Selma, as they prepare to break camp today and resume their march to the state capitol at Montgomery. The demonstrators spent a cold night in tents in an open field about seven miles from Selma, where the march started out yesterday. March 24, 1965
